alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Montgomery; Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:14AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Toombs, southeastern Emanuel and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 114 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Canoochee to Charlotteville, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lyons, Vidalia, Twin City, Uvalda, Stillmore, Oak Park, Garfield, Santa Claus, Alston, Ohoopee, New Branch, Canoochee, McNatt Falls, South Thompson, English Eddy, Cedar Crossing, Johnson Corner, George L Smith State Park, Center and Toombs Central. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
